loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional cows to help her on the farm and to help her husband's business

loans.name: Arzygul's Group

texts.en: Arzygul S., 25, is the leader of this group and resides in Nookat. She has a two-year-old son. Arzygul’s husband is a taxi driver and breeds livestock animals. Arzygul stays at home and helps him in taking care of livestock and reselling it. It’s been only a year since the start-up of this business, but she feels confident that she will develop this business successfully. She plans to spend this loan on purchasing sheep and parts for a car. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and auto parts for their car

loans.name: Khemra's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Khemra has been selected as group leader of a group of four members who are taking out this loan in the hope that it will improve their families' standards of living.

Mr. Khemra was born in 1981. He is a pig breeder and a Khmer cheese seller in local market where he can earn some profit to support his family. Since his business is getting on well, he wants to expand. So to this end Mr. Khemra is seeking a loan to buy more Khmer cheese for resale. His wife, Mrs. Chenda, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to help support her family.

This couple supports two children, one of whom is a student, while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: to buy more Khmer cheese for resale

loans.name: Saidakhon's Group

texts.en:
Saidakhon H., 26, is the leader of this group and she resides in Nookat. Her husband is in Russia, where he had to go in search of better employment. Saidakhon is bringing up a one-year-old child and works in fruits and vegetables retail. The business was started recently and she is currently being helped by her parents. The monthly profit is only $65, so Saidakhon requests a loan for investing in the business and broadening the goods circulation. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle for her traveling needs.

loans.name: Selfha

texts.en:
Selfha S. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Selfha is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She is also selling vegetables like ampalaya (bitter melon) and bananas. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Selfha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Selfha is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira A., 21, is the leader of this group and resides in the town of Nookat. She is not married, but lives with her father and two of her brothers, the oldest of whom teaches and the youngest serves in the army. A long time ago the family used to breed cattle, but soon her father earned enough to purchase a car and start driving a cab. It’s the main source of income for the entire family. 

Elmira herself works as an interpreter of the Chinese language and would like to ask for a loan to pay for her studies. She would like to successfully graduate and visit China in the future. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for her study of the Chinese language

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara M. lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband worked hard, but unfortunately his salary did not cover the expenses of their household at all. In 1993, in order to find a means of subsistence, they went off to Russia in search of a living and worked in a cafe. In 2006 they came back to Kyrgyzstan and opened a cafeteria in Osh city, using a start-up capital of 20,000 KGS. They worked a lot to make their café one of the most popular places, and achieved success. 

But in June of 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in Osh city, Gulsara lost her business. Her cafeteria was robbed and burned. But Gulsara, being a very optimistic person, didn’t give in. In order to reconstruct her cafeteria, she decided to engage in reselling foodstuffs. She rented a selling place at the local market and took different kinds of frozen goods on credit from her business partners. This fact indicates a great confidence in Gulsara’s personality and the prosperous future of her business.
 
Now, Gulsara is applying for a loan of 135.000 KGS, which she needs to broaden her assortment of goods.  With the revenues, she plans to resume her cafeteria business and continue to work. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods for sale

loans.name: Lynmar

texts.en:
Lynmar S. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Lynmar is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, buying and raising pigs for resale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lynmar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Lynmar is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Santa Cruz, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Salkynai's Group

texts.en:
Salkynai J., 29, is the leader of this group and a resident of the town of Nookat. Her husband is a construction worker and they have a young son and a daughter. Salkynai is busy selling groceries in a local market and remembers her start when she had only 3,000 KGS to invest. At this moment she is doubling the capital and receives a profit of about $108 monthly. The purpose of the loan is to purchase more goods and increase her working capital. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina I. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Divina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling baked goods like loaf breads, cookies and pastries in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Divina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. 

Divina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, sugar and milk. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like flour, sugar and milk

loans.name: Alimbubu's Group

texts.en:
Alimbubu T., 50, is the leader of this group. She resides in Tashkomur, is married, and is bringing up a nineteen-year-old girl. Alimbubu’s husband is a cashier, and along with that he helps take care of their cattle. She herself is a high school teacher and started this business twenty years ago. The business brings in about $215 a month. 

Alimbubu applied for a loan because she would like to purchase more cattle for breeding. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Urpayan's Group

texts.en:
Urpayan B., 50, is the leader of this group. She and her husband and their kids live in the town of Tashkomur. Her husband is a truck driver. The oldest sons work in Russia and the youngest go to school. Urpayan herself is a cattle breeder. 

More than twenty years ago, her mother-in-law gave her a goat, and that’s when she decided to deepen this business. She succeeded and increased the business to fifteen head. Now it generates a monthly revenue of about $256. The loan will be spent on purchasing sheep for further reselling. 

          --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Burulkan's Group

texts.en: Burulkan T., 54, is the leader of this group. She resides in the town of Tashkomur, is married and doesn’t have any financial dependants. Burulkan works in a local hospital and along with that breeds cattle. She started this business by her own initiative and has a stable income. Every month she receives 8,000 soms of income and needs some additional funds in order to purchase more head of cattle, so Burulkan decided to apply for a loan. She believes it can help her to promote the business. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Gina is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an envirofit cookstove

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from dried fish vending.  Norma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis D. lives with his wife and son in Stepanavan. By profession, Aramayis is a construction worker. He is also engaged in agriculture.  He has a small cattle farm and grows potatoes and fruit trees.

To organize the spring work and insure an income, Aramayis has applied for this loan to purchase potato seed, fuel and cattle food.

loans.use: to buy potato seed, fuel and cattle food

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine H. lives with her husband, mother-in-law and 2 children in Katnaghbyur village of Lori region. Unable to find a job locally, Hermine’s husband goes abroad for seasonal work.

Hermine keeps a cattle farm, grows potatoes and fruit trees which generate the family’s main income. Hermine would like to increase the income by purchasing 3 young bulls.

loans.use: to buy 3 young bulls

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en: Following his father’s death a year ago, Tigran H. takes full care of his mother, grandmother and 2 young brothers. Tigran works at a local factory and looks after a small cattle farm and fruit orchard. To expand the business and raise the profit, Tigran has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
In the province of Kompong Thom, Chhin E., 25, has been feeding piglets in the cage behind her house for selling when they are big enough.  Her husband is a recycling buyer and they can make an income of $2.50 per day. They have given birth to a child who is still enrolled in a local school.

In order to increase her income, Chhin E. would like to ask for a loan as an advance for purchasing cashews in bulk for resale. This couple intends to finish college, to expand the business, and they want to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to purchase cashews in bulk for resale

loans.name: Styopa

texts.en:
Styopa G. runs a CD shop in Meghri city, a mountainous, sunny and fertile landmark. Styopa is the main breadwinner, taking care of his mother, wife and son. 

To meet his clients' demands, Styopa needs to introduce new items in his shop: mobile and computer accessories. This will also increase Styopa's income and improve his household's conditions.

loans.use: to buy mobile and computer accessories for resale

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh C. is a 46-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Thom province. 

She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as rice and corn, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband grows these crops with her. 

The couple is married and has five school-aged children. Because their farm is outside a watering system, Sanh C. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Enhzaya

texts.en:
Enhzaya J. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, 7 and 11, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent.  

Her husband works as a builder during summer and he works as a fireman and guard during other seasons. Her two sons both attend a secondary school. 

She manages a grocery store near to her home. She started her business in 2010 and is planning to continue her business in the future. However, Enhzaya herself decided to work in a private retailing company beginning in June, 2011. So her mother will take charge of her business operation from then on. 

Her business is quite profitable because of the good location, and customers are happy with the polite and honest service that she provides. She opens her store from March to November and shuts it down during winter times when the profit is much less compared with other seasons.

Enhzaya is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "One can do anything if one lives healthy." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products in order to increase the varieties of her goods for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a married woman with five children. Four of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marjorie is 44 years old. 

Marjorie has a spices and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Marjorie would like to send her children to school and have a good job.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
Hrachik G. raises livestock. He has been able to grow the business, and with the income received, he successfully paid the education fees for his three children. 

With the help of this loan, Hrachik plans to improve the business further by buying food for the sheep. 

Hrachik is a an experienced and skillful farmer and has all the potential to grow his family business.

loans.use: to buy food for the sheep

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. is from the village of Sinamar. She is 52 years old. Teresita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Teresita raises crops, primarily corn, for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 60,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane M. maintains a cattle farm, keeps beehives, and cultivates the land. Since 2009, Gayane has been a client of SEF, and with the help of the loans she has been able to access, she has been able to grow her business. 

Apart from owing her own land, Gayane also rents a portion of land. She needs additional financial resources to be able to cultivate it. This loan will cover the cost of the seeds that Gayane requires for the spring planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant in the spring

loans.name: Ovsanna

texts.en:
Ovsanna and her husband keep a cattle farm. Ovsanna’s husband also buys and sells meat produce. Ovsanna is preparing to expand the business by starting a land cultivation business. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase potato seeds. 

Ovsanna lives with her husband, their three children, and parents-in-law.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon P., age 55, is a farmer. She and her husband grow rice, vegetables, and fruit on their own farmland. Farming is something with which the couple has had great success. They are able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both the rainy and dry seasons. 

The couple has three children and the family lives in the Dongkor district of the city of Phnom Penh. Two of her children are employed in different jobs to earn an income. To facilitate the increasing living expenses of the family, Nuon P.'s husband also operates a motor-taxi service. 

Nuon P. is looking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle which will be used by her employed children to commute to their workplaces.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle which will be used by her employed children to commute to their workplaces

loans.name: Aram

texts.en: Aram H. has a fishery. The nature around his fishery is beautiful and pure. Aram is planning to expand his business by purchasing beehives and fish meal. A pure and very healthy honey can be produced in nature like this. Aram’s family- his teacher wife, his pensioner mother and 3 children- will greatly benefit from the additional income. There are always plenty of buyers of quality honey, which is so much in demand locally, as most Armenians like home remedies, and honey is a must have item for each household here.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and fish meal

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 50-year-old, married man with 5 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent residential house. He is a farmer and also trades in cattle. Emmanuel has been in this kind of business for 13 years. He has a challenge of inadequate market demand and has a desire to venture into urban markets. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar V. lives with her husband and children in Talin city. With joined family efforts they are engaged in agriculture, which generates the main income for the hard-working family. To improve her family’s living conditions, Gohar has started to make bread, doing night shifts at the local bakery. Gohar would like to grow the family business. With this loan, Gohar will be able to purchase cattle food and 6 heads of cattle.

loans.use: cattle food and 6 heads of cattle

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung N., age 37, earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. She earns additional income by planting and harvesting rice. Her husband sells firewood in and around the local community. The couple has three children, all of whom help their mother with the pigs. 

Soung N. will use this loan to buy a cart for her husband to connect to his motorcycle so that he can transport firewood in larger quantities, allowing for more lucrative sales.

loans.use: to buy a cart for her husband to connect to his motorcycle so that he can transport firewood in larger quantities, allowing for more lucrative sales

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita Felician, 55, has learned the spirit of stewardship. This is how she values things, small or great, and opportunities that come her way. She is married to Vergelio and is blessed with 2 children who are currently in high school. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines. Having finished only high school, Pacita is determined to pursue her desire of having her own business to have a good life and a bright future for her children. 

She has operated her own buy-and-sell business of golf balls for 20 years now. She basically purchases these balls in bulk and repacks them into 150-200 PHP per pack and sells them to golfers. Her store is strategically located outside the Philippine Navy Golf Course in Taguig City, Metro Manila.  It is quite accessible to all golf players. She also offers candies and cold drinks (mineral water and soft drinks). Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 10,000 PHP.

To help continue operation of her business, Pacita is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this amount to purchase additional golf balls and candies to restock her inventory. She believes through the proper use of this loan, she will increase her earnings.

Pacita dreams of having her house renovated soon and be able to send her child all the way through college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional golf balls to sell

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee, age 45, used to work in a supermarket as a salesperson. In 2008, she decided to rent a splace and open her own small grocery shop. Since then, she has been running her business successfully. She plans to build her own space for her shop as well as to increase her working capital and profit. 

Tsetsgee is a positive person with good communication skills. This is her second time taking out a loan from Credit Mongol. She is requesting her new loan in order to expand her inventory and increase her current assets.  

Tsetsgee lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small wooden house on their own plot of land. Her husband works in Bridge Construction, a construction company. Their daughter Odonchimeg, age 19, attends university, and their son Dashnyam, age 15, goes to the local secondary school.

loans.use: to expand her inventory and increase her current assets

loans.name: Irailakan's Group

texts.en:
Irailakan T., age 55, is the leader of this group. She has earned a living by offering convenience goods for sale for the past 34 years. Her monthly profit is 3,000 soms. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to purchase more goods so that she can increase the turnover of her business. With part of the loan, she will purchase fertilizers and seeds for farming. In the future, she wants to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Irailakan lives with her husband and family in Uzgen, a beautiful and ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension in amount of 2,500 soms. Together they have raised seven children: the youngest son is 15.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support two children. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.
She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she is able to cook inside the house since the Envirofit cookstove does not emit a lot of smoke like other ordinary woodstoves.

Gina is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support two children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from trees in her surroundings.

Grace is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: 1  Mật Sơn 1 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Dụ N. Thị, age 75, is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 1 Mật Sơn 1 Đông Vệ (08.02.1 Đông Vệ).
 
Dụ lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is widowed and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Dụ owns and operates a food stall, selling peanuts in the local community. Dụ has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Dụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Dụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting her second loan of 6,159,600 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital. Dụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

Lê Thị Vân (age 32), Lê Thị Kỷ (age 70), and C. Thị Lan (age 45), are each requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support their individual furniture-making businesses.

Lê Thị Thái (age 61) is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

---------
 
Dụ N. Thị (1) là 75 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Dụ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 1 Mật Sơn 1 Đông Vệ (08.02.1 Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán đậu phụng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Dụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dụ kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Dụ đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Dụ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Vân (4) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


2.  Lê Thị Kỷ (6) là 70 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  C. Thị Lan (7) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Lê Thị Thái (8) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to employ as working capital

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang D., age 25, owns a small shop located along the street in her village, in Kompong Thom province. She sells soft drinks, food, sweets, cooking ingredients, and other goods. She typically makes around US $2 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Her husband, Mr. Van D., is a primary teacher in the community. They have two school-aged children, both of whom are attending school. 

In addition to her sales business, Leang D. cultivates potatoes on her own farm as an annual crop. She would like to apply for a loan in order to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house as well as to use as capital to grow more potato crops.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for providing electricity to her house as well as to use as capital to grow more potato crops

loans.name: Jocelyn

Jocelyn requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to use it as an alternative to LPG or gas stove to save money.

Jocelyn is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from trees in her surroundings.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon E., age 52, is a corn farmer. She has planted and harvested corn to offer for sale for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Corazon is unmarried.

In 2008, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to plant and raise. 

Corazon is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for use in her field. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Corazon from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, to use in her field

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 53 years old and married with one child.

Angeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Angeline has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from the sale of gasoline.

Angeline aspires to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jenila

texts.en:
Jenila is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenila is 47 years old. 

Jenila has a selling of dry goods business in the Philippines. Jenila requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods and plastic ware.

Jenila has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Jenila would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods and plastic ware

loans.name: Ervina

texts.en:
Ervina is 46 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising carabao (water buffalo), pigs and goats in the Philippines. Ervina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Ervina has been in business for five years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to finish her children's education.

loans.name: Mariano Rogelio

texts.en:
Mariano Rogelio B. is from the village of Palabotan Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 42 years old. Mariano Rogelio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mariano Rogelio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the primary source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Mariano Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mariano Rogelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mariano Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mariano Rogelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

location.town: Palabotan Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing.  Vivian is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and piglets for her pig fattening business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to send her kids to school.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men Y. is from the province of Kompong Thom. She earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in selling firewood in and around his village. The couple has two young children who do not yet study in school. Men Y. has raised a lot of piglets that she hopes to sell to buyers four months after she begins raising them. In order to earn extra income, Men Y. will be using the loan to buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise for selling. (Men Y. and her young kid were pictured in the photograph).

loans.use: To buy more pig-feed and piglets to raise for selling.

Janeth has been in this business for five years. Janeth earns more income buying and selling mahogany seeds.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

They have three single children who still live with them. Thlang S.’s husband wishes to have more funds to increase his capital for buying additional firewood for resale. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.name: Thay

texts.en: Thay M. is a 40-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Siem Reap province. She is a tailor who sews the villagers' clothes in front of her house. She also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee. She has a life partner in her husband who works as an internal staff member in a private organization in Oddar Meanchey province. The family has only one kid who is attending school. Thay M. would like a loan of $500 in order to purchase more cloth for providing her clothing service.

loans.name: Tural

texts.ru: Tural I. 24 qoda. On projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so s semyoy. Tural ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On s malix let nachal rabotat v raznix rabotax tak kak u nix semya bila bednaya i on bil vinujden podrabativat. Tural uje 4 qoda kak rabotayet v etom konsultativnom biznesse. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy kompyuter dlya toqo chtobi ludshe obslujivat kliyentov  i razvit svoy bizness. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svayeqo ludsheqo druqo kotoriy i pomoq yemu vo vsem.
texts.en: Tural I. is 24 years old.  He lives in the Absheron region with his family.  Tural is single and childless.  Since he was small he has been working doing various things because his family was poor and he had to.  Tural has been working as a consultant for four years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy a new computer to better serve his customers and expand his business.  He started this business with his best friend who helps him in everything.

loans.use: to buy a new computer

loans.name: Pan's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of sixteen members. The members of this group will use their money to support their different purposes. Mrs. Pan is a village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Pan was born in 1984 and is married to Mr. Maen, who was born in 1987. Mrs. Pan stays at home and cooks for the family. She has a child who is attending a local school. Mrs. Pan's husband is a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to support his family. Aside from being a construction worker he also earns his living by fishing. In order to support her husband's fishing activities, Mrs. Pan is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets for her husband to use.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her husband to use

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann P. is a 31-year-old mother who cares for three single children. Vann P. is a recycling seller - she buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she buys include the oldest things, electric wires, plastic products, bottles, cans, and other used goods. Her husband always assists her in the same business, and they can earn a profit of approximately $5 a day to ensure that their family lives a proper life. Vann P. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more used goods for stocking up to re-sell in order to increase her profits. She is going to use the rest of loan fund for repairing her house.

loans.use: To buy more used goods for stocking up to re-sell and to repair her house.

loans.name: Soam's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen members form this village bank loan group. Mrs. Soam is a village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Soam and her husband Mr. Roth are farmers who own a plot of land. They use the land to grow different vegetables for their family living. They do not have enough money to grow this farming business. Thus, Mrs. Soam would like to ask for a loan to use for cultivating vegetables.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Soam's husband also earns a living by fishing in the local village. The couple has four children: two are seamstresses in garment factories, one is an iron welder, and the last one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To cultivate vegetables

loans.name: Ahalil Soum Group

texts.fr:
Haoua est la présidente du groupe AHALIL SOUM. Elle habite à Nongremassom  à Ouagadougou. Elle est célibataire. Elle a 05 enfants en charge dont 02 vont à l’école. 

Elle fait la fabrication de bijoux et de colliers. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Ouaga. Elle vend principalement aux Ivoiriens et avec quelques clients qui viennent d’autres régions du Burkina.

Avec ce prêt, elle veut acheter  20 paquets de billes et 10 paquets de fils, pour produire plus de bijoux.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour investir dans la vente d’habits pour femmes. A l’avenir, elle voudrait s’acheter une parcelle, une moto et elle aimerait mettre du courant et de l’eau courant dans sa maison familiale.
texts.en:
Haoua is the president of the AHALIL SOUM group. She lives in Nongremassom  in Ouagadougou. She is single raising five children, of whom two are enrolled in school.  

She makes jewelry and necklaces. She has been doing this for seven years. She buys her supplies in Ouagadougou. She mainly sells to people from the Ivory Coast with a few clients who come from other regions of Burkina. 

With this loan, she wants to buy 20 packets of beads and 10 packets of string so that she can produce more jewelry. 

She uses her profit to invest in selling women's clothing. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land and a motorcycle. She would also like to put in electricity and running water in her family home.

loans.use: to buy 20 packets of beads and 10 packets of string to make more jewelry.

loans.name: So's Group

texts.en:
The sixteen people who make up this village bank loan have selected Mrs. So to become the village bank president. They each will use their portions of the loan in various ways to improve their families' living. 

Mrs. So was born in 1977 and is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy more pig food and piglets for breeding in order to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. 

Mrs. So's husband Mr. Em is a soldier. He receives a small salary to support his family. The couple has five children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, two are attending the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy more pig food and piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S. is a 27-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor commune, Kompong Cham province. Chhuon S. is married to Mr. Kong Kimsroun, age 27, who works with her in the farming business. This couple has years pf experience in the agriculture sector. They can grow their crops accordingly in the rainy season and dry season, and they mostly get great results from their crop-growing business. In addition, Chhuon S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn more income. Chhuon S. has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima B. is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married. Her husband works as a teacher of Russian language at school. They have two children, both of whom study at school.  Fatima works at school along with her husband. In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses the family breeds cattle. They earn an additional 2000 soms per month reselling some farm animals after fattening. Fatima wants to purchase a calf for breeding with the money received from the loan.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Fikret

texts.ru: Fikret M. 42 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Fikret jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kulenku , reyki , qvozdi i t.d dlya postroyki parnika. Takje on  kupit nekatoroye kolichestvo udobreniya  dlya uluchsheniya urojaya i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Fikret M. is 42 years old.  He is married with three children.  Fikret lives in the Absheron region with his family.  He has been farming for seven years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy boards, nails, etc. to build a greenhouse.  He also wants to buy some fertilizers to reap a bigger harvest and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy building materials and fertilizer

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong L., age 57, earns a living by selling dried fish at market. She lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh city. She is a widow and has three children, all of whom are married and working in different occupations. They help their mother by providing small monthly sums of money for her to use toward the family's living expenses.

Hong L. is concerned about the conditions of her house, which is old and in need of frequent repair. She is requesting a loan in order to make necessary repairs to her house.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to her old house

loans.name: Vusala

texts.ru:
Vusala jivet v Absheron regione , ona zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Vusala ochen lubit svoyu semyu i rabotu. Vusala M. 29 let. Ona uje 5 let kak kak imeyet sobstvenniy produktoviy magazin. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina chtobi pomestit bolshe raznix tovarov.
texts.en: Vusala lives in the Absheron region.  She is married and has one child.  Vusals loves her family and her work very much.  Vusala M. is 29 years old.  She has had her own grocery shop for five years.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to expand the size of her shop so that she will have room for more products.

loans.use: to expand the size of her shop

loans.name: Gazanfar

texts.ru: Gazanfar A. 40 let. On jenat jenat i uje imeyet 2 detey odin iz kotorix xodit v shkolu. Gazanfar jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so voimi lubimimi detmi i jenoy. Uje 13 let kak Gazanfar zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Gazanfara , v perviy raz on bral 1200$, i ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za ssudu. On oplachival svoyu ssudu yejemesechno bez opazdaniy. I seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit sajenci i shtili dlya posadki. Posle pervoy ssudu on uvelichil svoi ploshadi dlya posadki.
texts.en: Gazanfar A. is 40 years old.  He is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school.  Gazanfar lives in Baku with his beloved children and wife.  He has been farming for thirteen years.  This is Gazanfar’s second loan.  The first time he borrowed $1200, and he is very thankful to Kiva lenders for this.  He paid off his loan monthly, never late.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy seedlings for planting.  After his first loan, he expanded his plot of land for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting

loans.name: Yath

texts.fr: Monsieur Yath W. habite  dans la localité de Yoff  ou il exerce son activité de couturier depuis plus de 25 ans. Il aime beaucoup la création. Il a choisi son activité par amour, en plus du fait qu’il est issu d’une famille de tailleur. Il l’a hérité de son père. Monsieur W. est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis aout 2007.Il a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus destinés a confectionner des habits qu’il expose et  vend en prêt a porter. Les revenus générés par ce financement lui permettront  de régénérer  son activité qui devenait de moins en moins rentable pour lui. Son objectif est de récupérer  sa clientèle perdue.
texts.en: Mr Yath W. lives in Yoff where he is a dressmaker for 25 years. He really loves designing. He was born in a tailor family and chose this activity out of love. He inherited the business from his father. Mr W. is a member of our branch in Yoff since August 2007. He already paid off his previous loan. He is now applying to a 300 000 frs loan to buy cloth to design clothes that he exhibits and sells as ready-to-wear clothes. The generated income will allow him to dynamized his business which was becoming less and less profitable lately. His goal is to get back his lost clients.

loans.use: To buy cloth and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Bineta N. est une dame divorcée  de 40 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle a en charge un enfant de 4 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle a choisi cette activité pour avoir abandonné l’école et vouloir se procurer des revenus qui lui permettront  de se prendre en charge. Madame N. est sociétaire du guichet depuis 2003 et a déjà remboursé  2 prêts  antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus, de parfums et de thioubs destinés a la vente. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux  gérer ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Madame Bineta N. is a 40 year-old divorced woman and lives in Yoff. She is taking care of a 4 year-old. She decided to drop out of school and to work to make money and to be able to take care of herself. She now has a business for the last 5 years. Madam N. is a member of our branch in Yoff since 2003 and already paid off 2 previous loans. She is applying to a 200 000 frs loan to buy cloth, perfumes and thioubs (traditional tinted fabrics) for resale. The generated revenue will enable her to better manage her personal needs.

loans.use: To buy cloth, perfumes and  thioubs (traditional tinted fabrics)

loans.name: Afila

texts.ru: Afila K. rodilas v 1956 qodu. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom i pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Afila uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom, ona razvodit korov. Seychas Afila nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Afila K. was born in 1956.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.  She is married with three children.  Afila has been working as a herdsman, raising cattle, for ten years.  Now Afila needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mbene

texts.fr: Madame Mbene S. est une femme mariée  de 43 ans qui habite à Yoff. Elle évolue dans la vente de poissons depuis plus de 10ans. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi pour avoir les moyens d’épauler son mari. Aussi elle veut lutter contre l’oisiveté. Elle est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis longtemps. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle emprunte 100 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son fond de roulement. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus à travers ce financement afin de parvenir à constituer une épargne et démarrer  un petit commerce parallèle. L’idée  est de diversifier  les produits qu’elle vend.
texts.en: Madam Mbene S. is 43 year-old married woman and lives in Yoff. She sells fish for more than 10 years, she chose to do it to help her husband and to keep herself busy. She has been a member of our branch in Yoff for a long long time now and she paid off a previous loan. She borrows a 100 000 frs loan to increase her working capital. Her goal is to increase her revenue, to be able to save money and to start a small business on the side. The idea is to diversify the products she sells.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Shirzad

texts.ru: Shirzad jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka, yemu 52 qoda. Shirzad S. yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy nebolshoy semyoy. On uje 12 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Shirzad prodayet moloko, yogurt i kefir i poetomu seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelichit kolichestvo produkta tak kak na neyo yest bolshaya potrebnost sredi pokupateley.
texts.en: Shirzad S. is married and has one child.  He is 52 years old.  Shirzad is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his small but beloved family.  He has been working as a herdsman for twelve years.  Shirzad sells milk, yogurt, and kefir.  Therefore, he now needs 2000 AZN to buy a cow since he has a great deal of demand from his customers, and this would increase production.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 33 سنة يعمل في بيع وتصليح الكومبيوتر له في عمله 6 سنوات يعمل بشكل جيد وله زبائن من محيطه وجرانه يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يحسن وضعه يسعى الى تغيير الواقع المادي والاجتماعي له يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة يواجه  صعوبة بعدم توفير الامكانيات اللازمة يحلم بتكبير محله حتى يصبح مؤسسة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كومبيوترات جديدة والعاب وخطوط لتعبئة الهواتف يعمل بنشاط لافت وحب للعمل
texts.en: Ali is 33 and sells and repairs computers for a living. He has 6 years’ experience in this, and has many local customers. He wants to increase his income and thereby improve his prospects and his financial and social situation. With this loan he wants to purchase necessities that he currently can't afford for his store, such as new computers, games and phone lines. He dreams of expanding his store into a company. He is enthusiastic and loves his job.

loans.use: to purchase new computers, games and other necessities for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Volimata

texts.fr: Madame Valimata K. habite dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et âgée  de 42 ans.  Elle a 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de sandwichs. C’est sous l’influence de sa sœur qu’elle s’est orientée dans le secteur  du commerce pour ne serait ce une prise en charge partielle de ses besoins personnels. Dans le souci de diversifier son activité de commerce elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs pour acheter des thioubs qui seront destinés à la vente. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d’améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en: Mrs. Valimata K. lives in the Yoff district. She is married, 42 years old and has seven children. She has a business selling sandwiches, an activity she went into as a result of her sister's influence, if only to provide partially for some of her personal needs. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs with the intention of diversifying her business and buying "thioubs" (special tinted fabric) which she will sell. The profits she makes will allow her to improve her social living conditions.

loans.use: to buy "thioubs" (special tinted fabric)

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Fatou S.  vit à yoff. Elle est âgée  de 31 ans. Elle est éducatrice dans le préscolaire depuis plus de 5 ans. Après sa formation en secrétariat elle ne parvenait pas  à trouver un boulot. Ainsi mademoiselle S. ne s’est pas découragé et a refait une autre formation en monitoring. Par la suite elle a été recrutée   dans une institution préscolaire de la place. Elle est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis janvier 2004. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’aménagement de la cuisine de ses parents. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Fatou S. lives in Yoff, a town of Dakar. She is 31 years old. She has been an educator in the preschool for over five years. After getting her secretarial training she could not find a job, so S. decided to get another degree, in education this time. Subsequently she was recruited in a preschool institution. She is a member of the Yoff group since January 2004. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to refurbish her parents kitchen. This loan will help to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to invest in home refurbishments

loans.name: Ana Karina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA  C. LABORA COMO  SECRETARIA EJECUTIVA, ES ACOMPAÑADA, TIENE  CINCO PERSONAS  A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO CON CEPRODEL, LO NECESITA PARA PONER UNAS CUENTAS AL  DIAS DE  CONSUMO DE ENERGIA, AGUA,SERVICIOS BASICO SU VIIVENDA.
texts.en: Mrs. C. is employed as an Executive Secretary.  She has a spouse and five people are in her care.  This is her first loan with Ceprodel.  She needs it to pay her utility bills: electricity, water and basic home services.

loans.use: to pay her utility bills.

loans.name: Mayra Segovia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA G. LABORA COMO ANALISTA COMERCIAL, TIENE SEIS PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE LE BRINDA POR QUE CON ESTE DESEMBOLSO VA PODER RESOLVER GASTO DE CONSUMO  FAMILIA COMO PAGO DE ENERGIA Y OTROS
texts.en: Ms. Gonzales is a business analyst. She has six people in her care. This is the first loan she has been granted by CEPRODEL. She is thankful for the support provided because thanks to this credit she will be able to pay for family expenses such as electricity bill and others.

loans.use: To pay for family expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his house and to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ramon Enrique

texts.es: EL SEÑOR C. LABORA COMO TECNICO  EN TELEFONIA, ES SOLTERO ,TIENE CINCO  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA,LO NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA EN CONSTRUIR UN COCINA, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRIND
texts.en: MR. C. WORKS AS A TELEPHONE TECHNICIAN. HE IS SINGLE WITH FIVE DEPENDANTS. THIS IS HIS FIRST LOAN FROM CEPRODEL, AND HE NEEDS IT TO INVEST IN HOME IMPROVEMENTS - TO BUILD A KITCHEN, TO BUY SAND, BLOCKS, CEMENT, IRON, A BRACE, AND TO PAY FOR LABOUR. HE IS GRATEFUL FOR THE SUPPORT THIS INSTITUTION IS OFFERING HIM.

loans.use: to improve his home and purchase building materials

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FRANCISCO LABORA COMO AYUDANTE DE PERFORACION DE POZOS, ES CASADO, TIENE TRES HIJOS A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LOS NECESITA PARA INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA EN CONSTRUIR UN GARAJE, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO, ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco works as a well-drilling assistant and is married with three children under his care.  This is his first loan through CEPRODEL.  He needs it to invest in home improvement, building a garage, and to buy sand, bricks, cement, iron, and buttress materials as well as pay for labor costs.

He is grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for home improvement

loans.name: Angel Baltazar

texts.es: EL SEÑOR N. LABORA COMO AYUDANTE DE PERFORACION DE POZOS, ES CASADO, TIENE TRES HIJOS A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LOS NECESITA PARA CANCELAR DEUDA Y UNA PARTE INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA, EN CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA
texts.en:
Mr. N. works as a well-drilling assistant, is married and has three children in his care.  This is his first loan through CEPRODEL.  He needs it to cancel debt and use part of it to invest in home improvements.  He wants to build a room and plans to buy sand, bricks, cement, iron, buttress materials and pay for labor costs.

He is grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: To pay for personal housing expenses

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con los negocios de compra y venta de ganado y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes que trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia trabaja juntamente con su hijo, la socia quiere mejorar sus negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados y comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y fideos para la tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Paulina is 62 years old, single and has a son.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling livestock.  She also has a grocery store that she runs from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She works with her son and wants to improve her business.

Her loan request is to buy livestock and products such as rice, sugar and pasta for her grocery store.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy livestock and products such as rice, sugar, and pasta for her grocery store

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: EL SEÑOR N. LABORA COMO TECNICO DE PERFORACION DE POZOS, ES SOLTERO, TIENE CINCO  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LOS NECESITA PARA CANCELAR DEUDA  CON OTRA INSTITUCIONES BANACARIA Y UNA PARTE INVERTIRLO EN MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA, EN CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO, EN COMPRA DE ARENA, BLOQUE, CEMENTO, HIERRO,ESTRIBO, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA
texts.en:
Mr. N. works as a well-drilling assistant, is single and has five people in his care. This is his first loan through CEPRODEL. He needs it to cancel debt with other bank institutions and use part of it to invest in home improvements. He wants to build a room and plans to buy sand, bricks, cement, iron, buttress materials and pay for labor costs.

He is grateful to the institution for this support.

loans.use: To pay for personal expenses

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dionicia; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz y también se dedica a la venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz), también se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos y gallinas, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor y también  chanchos y gallinas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUMPAMPA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Dionicia is 44 years old, has a partner and five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business buying and selling corn.  She also sells "chicha" (a corn-based beverage) and raises animals such as pigs and hens.

She wants to expand and improve her business and is requesting a loan to buy corn, wholesale, as well as pigs and hens.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy corn, wholesale, as well as pigs and hens

loans.name: Fermin Alberto

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FERMIN LABORA COMO ANALISTA PRESUPUESTARIOS, ES CASADO, TIENE DOS  PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, LOS NECESITA PARA  MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA, EN REPARACION  DEL TECHO, COMPRA DE CINZ, PERLINE, EL PAGO DE LA MANO DE OBRA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE  ESTA INSTITUCION LE BRINDA.
texts.en: Sr. Fermin works as a budget analyst.  He is married and has two dependents.  This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL.  He needs the funds for a home improvement, specifically the repair of his roof.  Fermin will buy zinc, crossbeams, and pay for labor.  He is grateful for the support CEPRODEL has provided.

loans.use: To pay for materials and labor needed to repair his roof.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; ella tiene 64 años de edad y es casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y flores, la socia lleva a la ciudad de Cusco y lo vende en el mercado de Huancaro, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras y flores. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como tomates, cebollas, habas, pepinos y zanahorias y también para comprar flores.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Rosita de Ayllupampa” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 64 years old, married, and has nine children. Guillermina divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling vegetables and flowers. She leaves the city of Cusco so that she can sell at the market in Huancaro. Guillermina works from 8am to 4pm. She wants to improve and expand her vegetable and flower business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, beans, cucumbers, and carrots. She will also buy flowers.

Guillermina is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and flowers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
