Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Adicionalmente, cuenta con ingresos adicionales de la comercialización de frutas. Clara desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de más aves menores para engorde y en alimento balanceado para sus aves y cerdos. Por ello, solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old and single.  She currently lives in her own home in the small village of Tepo - San Carlos.  This is a rural area located 25 minutes from the city of Mochumi, in the north of Peru.  Her community is small and consists of approximately 200 families.

Clara has been earning a living raising and selling animals in pens located behind her home for 20 years.  She usually raises pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks.  When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who always visit the area where she lives.  Clara learned this business from her parents which means that she knows the work by heart.  She also makes additional income from selling fruit.

Clara would like to increase her business by purchasing more birds to fatten and balanced feed for her birds and pigs.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 35 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa familiar junto a su hermano y padre en el caserío de Prada en el distrito de Motupe. Su caserío no cuenta con el servicio básico de luz. Desde hace muchos años, David se dedica a la cultivación y venta de maracuyá. Vende la fruta desde su domicilio al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar su zona. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de abono para la cultivación de su fruta. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
David is 35 years old and single.  He lives in his family home, together with his brother and father, in the small village of Prada, in Motupe district.  David's village doesn't have access to a basic electricity service.  For many years, David has been growing and selling passion fruit.  He sells his fruit from his home to the general public and to the traders who usually visit his area.

David would like to invest his loan in buying manure for his fruit crop.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy manure for his passion fruit crop

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, su comunidad no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz o agua.

Se dedica a la cultivación de limón el cual lo asiste diariamente y lo cosecha semanalmente. También cuenta con una camioneta la cual la trabaja los días sábados y domingos realizando cargas de mercadería. Realizan estas actividades desde hace más de 6 años. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de abono para el limón y en el pago de jornales a los trabajadores que contrata para el desyerbo de su cultivo. Luis desea seguir creciendo en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis is 44 years old, married, and has one child.  He lives in his own home in Tambogrande, an agricultural area of Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Luis' community doesn't currently have access to the basic services of electricity or water.

Luis grows lemons.  He tends his crops every day and harvests them every week.  He also has a small truck which he uses on Saturdays and Sundays to transport merchandise.  He has been carrying out these activities for more than 6 years.

Luis would like to invest his loan in buying manure for his lemons and to pay day laborers who he hires to weed his crops.  Luis would like to continue growing in his business so that he can make more income and provide his family with a better quality of life.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy manure for his lemons

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new carpet-weaving frame and other important equipment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a  new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more modern equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fuel for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store

loans.name: Jezeil

texts.en:
Jezeil is a Paletinian woman from Rafah city, married and a mother of two daughters and three sons. Jezeil's husband is a pharmacist.

Jezeil took out a loan from FATEN to purchase medications, accessories and make-up items to sell in their pharmacy. The loan will help in increasing the variety and quantity of medications plus the accessories that will attract more customers.

Jezeil's husband appears in the picture here since she is a conservative woman as are most Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase medications and accessories to sell in the pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase essential tools for his vehicle repair workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her daughter to use to help her in her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more modern tools and build up his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more cloth, thread and a sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Abdulraheem

texts.en:
Abdulraheem is a young man from Qalqilia. He has a B.A. in Business Administration. Abdulraheem started his own business three years ago. He started a nuts and cereals shop which gives Abdulraheem a decent income.

Abdulraheem wants to increase the variety of edibles he sells which will attract a larger number of customers and increase his profit. Abdulraheem is photographed in FATEN's branch in Qalqilia.

loans.use: to increase the variety of nuts and cereals he sells.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger shop and help her son expand his business

loans.name: María Emilia

texts.es:
La Señora. María Q. es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas muy trabajadoras y siempre están en la lucha para sacar adelante a sus familias.
 
La Señora. María tiene de 66 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Su esposo labora como oficial de albañil, con el trabajo de los dos han logreado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de chanchos, gallinas y cuyes a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

En el banco comunal esta hace 6 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para comprar mas animales, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y pollos.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Q. is a member of "El Cisne" (The Swan) community bank.  She lives in San Miguel community which is located in El Valle parish.  This parish has a cold climate.  Its people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.  They are very hard-working people and are always striving to get their families ahead in life.

María is 66 years old, married, and has 5 grown-up children who are all married and live independently.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Through their joint work they have managed to build their own home.

María's business is raising pigs, hens and guinea pigs which she sells when she has a financial need to.

María has been a member of her community bank for 6 years and the loans she has received have helped her to buy more animals.  She will invest her new loan in buying pigs and chickens.

María's goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: María Uvaldina

texts.es:
La Señora María V. es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la comunidad de San Francisco que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas muy trabajadoras y siempre están en la lucha para sacar  adelante a sus familias.
 
Doña María tiene 46 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 24, 22, 21, 15, 12, y 5 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas son casadas e independientes, su tercera hija estudia en el colegio y también trabaja para ayudar a la economía del hogar, su cuarta hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su penúltimo hijo esta en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de chanchos, esta actividad que la realiza hace 12 años. En sus tiempos libres también se dedica a lavar ropa ajena, arregla casas y a  tejer sombreros de paja toquilla.
 
Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos.
 
Su meta es agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
María V. is a member of "El Cisne" (The Swan) community bank.  She lives in San Francisco community, which is located in El Valle parish.  This is a cold climate parish whose people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.  They are very hard-working people who are always striving to get their families ahead in life.

María is 46 years old, married, and has six children aged 24, 22, 21, 15, 12 and 5.  Her two eldest daughters are married and live independently.  Her third daughter is in high school and also works to help with their household expenses.  Her fourth daughter is in high school.  Her penultimate child (a son) attends a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker and, through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

María's business is selling pigs.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  In her spare time she also washes other people's clothes, cleans houses and weaves Panama hats.

This is María's fifth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying pigs.

María's goal is to extend her home.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny N. es socia del banco comunal El Cisne, vive en la comunidad de San Isidro que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, son personas muy trabajadoras y siempre están en la lucha para sacar adelante a sus familias.
 
La Señora. Fanny tiene 31 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de su comunidad. Su esposo labora como carpintero, con el trabajo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Fanny se dedica en su casa al negocio de chanchos y pollos, esta actividad la realiza hace 9 años y solo vende los días de feria. También labora como empleada domestica desde que tenía 15 años de edad y trabaja solo medio día de lunes a viernes.
 
Es socia fundadora del bankito comunal y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas chanchos.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Fanny N. is a member of "El Cisne" (The Swan) community bank.  She lives in San Isidro community, which is located in El Valle parish.  This is a cold climate parish whose people work in commerce, raise animals and farm.  They are very hard-working people who are always striving to get their families ahead in life.

Fanny is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged 13, 11 and 8.  All of her children are attending an elementary school in her community.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Through their joint work and sacrifice, they have managed to build their own home.

Fanny's business is raising pigs and chickens at home.  She has been in this business for 9 years and only sells her animals on market days.  She has also been working as a cleaner since she was 15.  She works half days from Monday to Friday.

Fanny is a founding member of her community bank and all her loans have helped her in her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying more pigs.

Fanny's goal is to finish off her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Lilia Lorena

texts.es:
Lilia tiene 34 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el Centro Poblado llamado La Matanza, en el distrito D. Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del Departamento D. Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. alimentos en una picantería desD. hace 4 años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. El negocio goza D. muy buena acogida por parte D. sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas. Lilia se vale D. los ingresos que recibe D. esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía D. su familia.

Lilia desea equipar su local con la compra D. sillas y mesas, D. esta manera ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lilia is 34 years old, married, and lives with her family in La Matanza, in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Lilia's business is making and selling meals in a small restaurant.  She has been in this business for four years.  She prepares her meals in her home and then sells them to the general public.  Her business is very popular with her customers because of the great flavor of her meals.  Lilia uses the income she makes in this business to help her husband cover their family's expenses.

Lilia would like to equip her premises by purchasing tables and chairs so that she can expand her business and increase her sales.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her premises

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 25 años, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el Centro Poblado llamado La Matanza, en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Alberto brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte la gente en la ruta entre Olmos y sus caseríos. 

Desea realizar algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. Asimismo desea comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Alberto is 25 years old, married, and lives together with his family in La Matanza, in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Alberto provides a passenger transport service in his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin in back which is used for transporting people).  He transports passengers along the route between Olmos and its small villages.

Alberto would like to make some improvements to his vehicle which is his main work tool.  He would also like to buy some accessories which he needs to keep his motorcycle in good condition so that he can continue offering a good service.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income and make some repairs to his home.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es soltera, tiene 34 años y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento que lleva el mismo nombre.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y gracias a ella colabora con el mantenimiento de la economía diaria.  Asimismo Norma, vende animales menores como ganado ovino, caprino, aves de corral y chanchos.

Norma desea adquirir mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante hogareña y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Norma is 34 years old, single, and lives together with her parents and siblings in Lambayeque province, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Norma's business is selling clothes.  She offers her products for sale both on credit and for cash.  She sells mainly to her neighbors and acquaintances.  This business is of great financial help to her family and it allows her to support the family financially.  In addition, Norma also sells animals such as sheep, goats, poultry and pigs.

Norma would like to acquire more merchandise in order to expand her business and increase her sales and profit levels.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

Norma is a home-loving woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  Those who know her consider her to be responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: to acquire more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ruth Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth Gonzáles es socia del banco comunal en Sueños y vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, su gente se dedica al comercio y es una ciudad que tiene muchos lugares para visitar.

Doña Ruth tiene 40 años, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 18 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de sus padres que es propia y comparten los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Ruth tiene con un local en donde se dedica a lavar la ropa en seco, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de detergentes, suavizantes de ropa y más productos para su lavandería.

Su sueño es construirse una casita.
texts.en:
Ruth Gonzáles is a member of the 'Sueños' (Dreams) community bank and lives in the city of Azogues.  This is a cold climate city of great architectural beauty.  Its people work in commerce and it is a city that has a lot of places to vist.

Ruth is 40 years old.  She is divorced and has two children aged 18 and 4.  Her eldest daughter is studying at University.  Ruth doesn't own her own home but lives in her parents' home (which they own).  She shares the household expenses.

Ruth has premises where she dry cleans clothes.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.

Ruth has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and she will use her loan to buy detergents, fabric softeners and other products for her laundry service.

Ruth's dream is to build a small house of her own.

loans.use: to buy detergents, fabric softener and other products for her laundry service

loans.name: Yessica Noely

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y vive junto a su familia en el Centro Poblado llamado La Matanza, en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco, atendiendo a la Campiña de Laynas y anexos.  Además Yéssica vende abarrotes a sus vecinos de la zona, quienes acuden a comprarle por el buen servicio que brinda y por la calidad de sus productos.  Con los ingresos que obtiene apoya al sustento económico de su familia.

Yéssica desea adquirir más mercadería (abarrotes), para venderla y así obtener mayores ingresos.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yéssica is 24 years old.  She lives with her partner in La Matanza, in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Yéssica's business is selling fresh fish.  She serves customers in Campiña de Laynas and surrounding villages.  Yéssica also sells groceries to her neighbors.  They come to buy from her because of the good customer service which she offers and the quality of her products.  She uses the income that she makes to help support her family financially.

Yéssica would like to acquire more merchandise (groceries) to sell and thereby make more income.  In order to achieve her goal, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to acquire more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 22 años, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Teófilo brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte la gente en la ruta entre Olmos y sus caseríos. 

Desea realizar algunas mejoras a su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo. Asimismo desea comprar algunos accesorios que necesita para mantener su moto en buenas condiciones y seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y hacer algunos arreglos en su domicilio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 22, is single living with his family in Olmos District located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Department’s capital.

Teófilo provides passenger transportation services in his Mototaxi, a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to move people around.  He transports people on the route between Olmos and their settlements.

He wants to do some improvements on his vehicle which is his work tool.  He also wants to buy some accessories he needs to keep his motorcycle in good condition to continue to offer good service.  With help from the loan he hopes to increase his income and to some home improvements.  He, therefore, has considered it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
Angela tiene 52 años de edad, reside junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Paiján, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de aproximadamente 25 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Angela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes durante la temporada de navidad, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Angela, age 52, lives with her children in the Paiján district.  There is a lot of commercial activity in this area, which is located in the La Libertad region.  It is over two hours to the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has a grocery store in her home.  She sells varied products like basic needs items and groceries to her neighbors.  The business is approximately 25 years old.  She currently has a fixed and loyal customer base.  Thanks to this business she has been able to support her family and get it ahead during all of this time.

Angela wishes to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.  That way she will be able to meet customer demand during the Christmas season.  That is why she feels it is advisable to request a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Odalia

texts.es:
Odalia tiene  43 años, es conviviente con 03 hijos de los cuales 02 aun dependen de el, con casa propia de material rustico sin servicios básicos (luz y agua), la única fuente de agua es la que obtiene de una pequeña vertiente que pasa por su terreno. El cliente vive en el caserío de Santa Teresa de Queromarca ubicado en el distrito de Callayuc (zona netamente rural) provincia de Cutervo.

Se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz  y menestras, en la actualidad siembra 02 hectáreas de café, los cuales luego vende para obtener ingresos y poder apoyar a su familia.

Odalia desea comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus terrenos de cultivo, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Odalia is 43 years old, married common-law, and she has 3 children, two of whom still depend on her. She has a house of her own but it is made of rustic materials and without any basic services (hydro and water). The only source of water is from a small stream that passes through her property. She lives in the community of Santa Teresa de Queromarca, located in the district of Callayuc (a rural zone) of the province of Cutervo. 

She cultivates coffee, corn, and legumes. She currently has 2 hectares of coffee, which she later sells to obtain an income to support her family. 

Odalia wishes to purchase fertilizers for her plantations, and for this reason she has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero y  reside junto a su hermano en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual vende a sus vecinos de su zona.  Además brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. 

José desea comprar más ropa para posteriormente venderla y, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jose is 32 years old, single, and he lives with his brother in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural zone located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital region of Lambayeque. 

He sells clothing to his neighbors in the region. He also provides transport services to passengers on his motorcycle rickshaw. It is a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and a cabin used to transport passengers inside. 

Jose wishes to purchase more clothing for later resale and in order to meet his objective he has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Miguel Augusto

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 52 años de edad. Es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, el cría estos animales en algunos ambientes ubicados cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de pastos naturales. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus propios vecinos. 

Miguel desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Miguel es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien trabajador y honesto.
texts.en:
Miguel is 52 years old, married common-law, and he lives with his family in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural zone in the region of Piura, located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque.

He raises and sells sheep. He raises these livestock in some spaces located near his house and he feeds them natural grasses. When they have reached a good level in their development he offers them for sale to the merchants who visit the region and to his own neighbors.

Miguel wishes to acquire more balanced feed to expand his business and to increase his earnings.  To this end he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. Miguel has been a very calm and responsible person. Those who know him consider him to be a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase balanced livestock feed

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos de limón y maracuyá el cual asiste diariamente y cosecha semanalmente, también cría aves de corral pavos y gallinas los cuales engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local, Estas actividades la realizan desde hace más de 5 años en la parte posterior de su casa. 

Rosa desea comprar de abonos para sus cultivos.  Por ello ha creido conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children. She lives together with her family in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural zone located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. 

She dedicates her time to the care of her lemon and maracuya fruit plantations. She takes care of them every day and she harvests the fruits weekly. She also raises foul, including turkeys and poultry. She fattens them to later sell them at the local market.  She has had these businesses for the past 5 years, installed in the back part of her house.

Rosa wishes to purchase fertilizers for her plantations. To this end she has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her plantations

loans.name: Nube Liliana

texts.es:
La Señora. Nube S. es socia del banco comunal en Sueños, vive en la comunidad de Uchupucum en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, su gente se dedica al comercio, es una ciudad que tiene muchos lugares para visitar.

Doña Nube tiene 63 años es casada y tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad,  casados y 4 de ellos viven independientes, una hija vive en su casa con quien comparte los gastos. Su esposo le ayuda en la atención de su bazar, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Nube es profesora jubilada y labora en su bazar hace 23 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia del mismo, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para su bazar como: regalos, tarjetas, peluches, bisutería, etc.

Su meta es llegar a tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nube S. is a member of the communal bank named "In Dreams". She lives in the community of Uchupucum in the city of Azogues. This city enjoys a cold climate and it has a vastly beautiful architecture. The population is dedicated to commerce and it is a city that has many locales to visit.

Nube is 63 years old, married, and she has 5 grown and married children. Four of them live independently. One of her daughters lives at home and she shares expenses with her. Her husband helps her manage her general store and with their mutual work they have managed to build a house of their own. 

Nube is a retired teacher and she has had her general store for 23 years. She works from Monday to Saturday, 9 in the morning until 8 at night.

She is on her second loan with her communal bank. She was invited to join by a friend who is a member of the bank. She will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise for her general store, such as: gifts, greeting cards, toys, jewelry, etc.

Her goal is to have a larger business.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as gifts, greeting cards, toys, and jewelry

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana C. es socia del banco comunal en Sueños, vive en la comunidad de San Marcos en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, su gente se dedica al comercio, es una ciudad que tiene muchos lugares para visitar.

La Señora. Ana tiene 23 años, casada y  un hijo de 1 año y 4 meses de edad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su mamá que es propia y comparten los gastos del hogar.

Doña Ana trabaja en un almacén en donde venden ropa deportiva, esta actividad la realiza hace 8 meses y labora de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y fue invitada por su hermana quien es socia activa del banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es tener un local de venta de ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
Ms. Ana C. is a member of the Banco Comunal En Sueños (In Dreams Communal Bank). She lives in the San Marco neighborhood of the town of Azogues. This is a town with cold climate and of great architectural beauty, rich in places to visit and whose inhabitants engage in trade.

Ana is 23 years old, she is married and has a child aged 1 year and 4 months. Her husband is a bus driver. As they do not have a house of their own, they live in her mother’s house contributing to the household expenses.

Ana works in a sport clothes department store. She started 8 months ago and she works there Mondays to Fridays form 8 am to 6 pm.

This is her second loan cycle. She has been invited in the group by her sister, who is an active member of the communal bank. She will invest the loan amount in the purchase of provisions for her family.

She aims at running a sport clothes shop.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her family.

loans.name: Ana Del Pilar

texts.es: Ana tiene 33 años y reside junto a su esposo en la comunidad de Pimental, a unos veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Transporte sus clientes entre Pimentel y sus alrededores. Desea usar su préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos para seguir solventado sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Ana is 33 years old, and she lives with her husband in the village of Pimentel, located at around twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She earns a living by offering transportation services with her mototaxi, a vehicle composed by a motorcycle and a cabin for passengers. She transports her customers from Pimentel to its vicinities. She wishes to use the loan to pay for the maintenance and repair works of her mototaxi. She needs to keep her vehicle in good conditions in order to keep on providing a good service to her customers. She hopes to increase her income thanks to the loan, in order to keep on paying for her household expenses. For this reason, she has thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: To maintain and repair her mototaxi.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Se dedica a la venta de CDs y DVDs. Cuenta con un puesto en el Mercado San Pedro. Es muy conocido en su comunidad y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. Desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Tambien desea hacer unos arreglos a su puesto para poder brindar una presentación profesional a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Carlos is a single man of 31. He lives in the Pacasmayo district, an area with a fair amount of business located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He engages in selling CDs and DVDs. He owns a stall in the San Pedro Market, he is very well-known in his town and he can count on regular customers. He wants to improve his sales by buying more products, as well as have some repair works done to his stall in order to present himself to his customers with a professional appearance. For this reason he has though it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

loans.use: To buy more products for his stall.

loans.name: La Gran Amistad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Gran Amistad se encuentra formado por 9 mujeres quienes luchan día a día en sus diferentes labores las mismas que les permiten ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, nuestras socias son mujeres muy trabajadoras y  ven a las dificultades con una sonrisa en los labios. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la agricultura y cría de animales, muchos han viajado fuera del país en busca de un mejor trabajo y por ende un mejor futuro para sus familias.

La Señora. María T. vive en la comunidad 3 de Noviembre en Cumbe y se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 3 años.
 
Tiene 41 años, es casada y ha concebido 7 hijos de 23, 22, 20, 18, 14, 10 y 7 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos son casados e independientes, su cuarta hija le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y sus tres últimos hijos estudian en una escalita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña María realiza los quehaceres domésticos de una casa en la que trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene en alguna necesidad económica.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cuyes.
 
Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The 'La Gran Amistad' (Great Friendship) community bank is made up of 9 women who work hard every day in their different businesses which allow them to help with their household expenses.  Our members are very hard-working women who face difficulties with a smile on their face.  They live on the outskirts of Cumbe parish.  This is a cold climate parish whose people work in commerce, farm and raise livestock.  Many people have traveled abroad in search of a better job and a better future for their families.

María T. lives in 3 de Noviembre community in Cumbe.  She has been a member of her community bank for 3 years.

María is 41 years old, married, and has seven children aged 23, 22, 20, 18, 14, 10 and 7.  Her eldest three children are married and live independently.  Her fourth child (a daughter) helps her with the housework and her three youngest children are attending a local school.  Her husband is a day laborer.  They don't own their own home and live in a rental house.

María cleans and looks after a house from Monday to Friday, from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  In her own home she raises guinea pigs which she sells when she has a financial need to.  She will invest her loan money in buying more guinea pigs.  Her biggest dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: Jorge tiene 38 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria. Su comunidad cuenta con servicios básicos de agua, luz, y desagüe y  ha mostrado en los últimos años un crecimiento  comercial bastante notable. Jorge gana su vida como mensajero. Trabaja para una empresa de mensajería y courier, contando con más de 3 años de experiencia. También, trabaja como electricista y cuenta con un taller mecánico en su domicilio donde brinda servicios de reparaciones. Desea hacer unos arreglos a su taller y también comprar más equipo eléctrico que necesita para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.  Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles. Con este crédito, no tendrá que recurrir a prestamistas informales que lo cobrarían tasas por encima del promedio financiero. Jorge es cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Jorge is 38 years old and single.  He lives in his parents' home which is located in La Victoria district.  His community has access to basic services such as water, electricity and drainage.  Over recent years, the community has shown remarkable signs of commercial growth.

Jorge earns a living as a messenger.  He has worked for a messenger and courier company for three years.  He also works as an electrician and has a workshop in his home where he provides repair services.  Jorge would like to make some repairs to his workshop and also buy some electrical equipment that he needs to provide a good-quality service to his customers.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  As a result of receiving this loan, he will not have to turn to informal lenders who would charge him rates above the financial average.  Jorge is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and he has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy more equipment and to make some repairs to his workshop

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María tiene 45 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 16 años. Vive en casa  familiar,  la cual está ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, Ana María se dedica a la venta y reparación de electrodomésticos, repuestos y accesorios similares. Cuenta con un puesto  fijo en el Mercado Modelo, un mercado grande y con bastante movimiento en Chiclayo. Ana María es bastante conocida en el sector y cuenta con clientela establecida. Desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para tener un mejor surtido en variedad. Esta inversión le permitirá lograr mejores ventas y mejor liquidez. Con mayores ingresos, podrá seguir solventando sus gastos familiares y los gastos escolares de su hija. Ana María es muy trabajadora y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María is 45 years old.  She is a single mother and has a 16 year-old daughter.  She lives in her family home which is located in José Leonardo Ortiz district, in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. 

For more than 10 years, Ana María has been repairing and selling electrical appliances, spare parts and accessories.  She has a fixed sales location in the 'Mercado Modelo', a large and busy market in Chiclayo.  Ana María is quite well known in her field and has an established customer base.  She would like to increase her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can have a better variety of products in stock.

This investment will allow Ana María to make better sales and improve her cash flow.  She will make more income which will enable her to continue covering her family expenses and paying for her daughter's education.  Ana María is very hard working and she has good personal and work references.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing her business so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un 1 hijo aun a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia y una prima en el distrito D. La Victoria, a unos veinte minutos D. Chiclayo, el capital D. la región D. Lambayeque. Su comunidad es urbana-marginal y cuenta con agua potable y energía eléctrica. María gana su vida vendiendo menestras cocidas. Ella prepara la comida en su casa y la venD. por kilos en el mercado local. Ella tiene más D. 20 años D. experiencia con este negocio. María desea aumentar su negocio con la compra D. más menestras, mote y frijoles en grandes cantidades. Esto le costará menos y será más rentable para su negocio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, María apoya a su esposo, el cual es carpintero, con los gastos familiares. Su mayor anhelo es seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old, married, and has 1 child still in her care.  She lives in her own home with her family and a cousin in La Victoria district, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María's community is a small, poor, urban community which has access to drinking water and electricity.  María earns a living selling vegetable stew.  She prepares her food at home and sells it by the kilo in her local market.  María has more than 20 years experience in her business.  She would like to increase her business by purchasing more mixed vegetables, corn and beans in large quantities.  This will cost her less and will be more profitable for her business.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  María uses her income to support her husband, who is a carpenter, with their family expenses.  Her greatest wish is to continue getting her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for preparing her vegetable stew

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres con su hermana y una prima en la parte rural del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú.  Su comunidad no cuenta con agua potable ni energía eléctrica. 

María se dedica a la crianza de animales como patos, pollos, y pavos. Ella cría estos animales en el terreno de su padre ubicado cerca a su domicilio y los alimenta de pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus propios vecinos. Tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en este rubro. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de terneros pequeños para engordarlos y venderlos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, María puede seguir apoyando a sus padres con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and single.  She lives in her parents' home with her sister and a cousin in a rural area of Reque district which is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in the north of Peru.  Her community doesn't have access to drinking water or electricty.

María's business is raising livestock such as ducks, chickens and turkeys.  She raises these animals on a plot of land belonging to her father which is located near her home.  She feeds them natural fodder.  When her animals have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who visit her area.  She also sells to her neighbors.

María has more than 15 years experience in this line of work.  She would like to invest her loan in buying young calves to fatten and sell.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  María will use her income to continue supporting her parents with their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Eung

texts.en: Mrs.Eung, born in 1979, is a farmer who rents a plot of land which she uses to grow rice to earn an income. Currently she wants to grow rice in the dry season, but doesn't have enough money to cultivate it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for hired laborers to plow her farm for cultivating rice. Aside from being a farmer, she also earns by knitting. Her husband, Mr. Boeun was born in 1979. He is a is a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He also helps in his wife's farming. This couple has three children: two are attending the local schools and the youngest one is only 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for hire laborers to plow her farm.

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es: Juan tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos  hijos. Vive en casa propia en la zona urbano-marginal del distrito de Lambayeque, en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con servicios de  luz,  pero no de agua potable. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias. Desde hace más de 2 años, brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Pretende comprar una nueva carpa y arreglar los asientos. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles. Juan tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien trabajador y honesto. Ha manejado préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen historial crediticio. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos para seguir solventado sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  He lives in his own home in a small, poor, urban community in Lambayeque district, in the north of Peru.  His community has access to electricity but not drinking water.  Juan's community is small, consisting of approximately 100 families.

For more than 2 years, Juan has been offering a passenger transport service with his motorcycle taxi (a vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He would like to use his loan to have some repair work and maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi.  He would like to buy a new roof and repair his seats.  Juan needs to keep his vehicle in good condition in order to continue offering a good service to his customers.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Juan has good references from his neighbors and acquaintances.  The people who know him consider him to be hard working and honest.  He has had previous loans from Edpyme Alternativa and he has a good credit history.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to increase his income in order to continue covering his family expenses.

loans.use: to repair the seats and buy a new roof for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
Jose tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente viven en casa propia en una zona rural en el Caserío Virgen La Purísima ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque, en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con servicios de  luz, pero no de agua potable. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 20  familias.

Se gana la vida desde hace 20 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Jose también cuenta con ingresos adicionales de sus trabajos de jornales en chacras en su distrito. José desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de aves menores para engorde y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Jose es un cliente antiguo de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen record de pagos. Es muy trabajador y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir generando buenos ingresos para continuar a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, 42, is married and has two children.  He lives in his own house in a rural area in the village of  Virgen La Purísima, located 15 minutes from Lambayeque, in the north of Peru.  His home has electricity but no potable water.  His village is small with only about 20 families.

For the past 20 years he has earned a living raising and selling small animals that he keeps in fenced areas in the back of his house.  He raises pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks and when they have grown to a good size, he sells them to merchants who come to the area where he lives.  He learned how to raise the animals from his parents and he is very knowledgeable about the work.  Jose also earns additional money as a day laborer in farms in his district.  Jose  would like to increase his business by buying small birds to fatten up and also to buy nutritionally balanced food.  That is why he is requesting a loan of 500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa.  He is a long-time client and has a good payment history.  Jose is hardworking and responsible and his biggest goal is to continue generating income so his family can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy more animals and nutritionally balanced food

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario tiene 47 años de edad. Reside junto a su esposa e hija en la casa de sus tíos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Con este trabajo, puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, Nazario desea invertir en la educación de su hija. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar el nivel de educación que su hija recibe para que ella pueda obtener mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para ayudar con sus gastos escolares. Este préstamo permitirá que Nazario trabaje más tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento tanto comercial como familiar. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Nazario is 47 years old, and resides with his wife and daughter in his uncle's house in the Jose Leonardo Ortiz district of the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than 10 years he has made his living offering transport services to passengers on his mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and a cabin to carry passengers in its interior.  With this work, he is able to pay his family's expenses.

At present, Nazario wishes to invest in the education of his daughter. His greatest hope is to improve the level of education his daughter receives so that she can obtain better opportunities in the future. For this reason, he has solicited a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 500 new sols to help with school expenses. The loan will permit Nazario to work more tranquilly without having to resort to loans from informal loan sharks who charge very high rates, which would prejudice Nazario's daily liquidity and set back both his commercial and family growth.

He is very grateful to Kiva for its help in moving his family ahead.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR THE EDUCATION OF HIS DAUGHTER

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen members. Mrs. P. is a village bank president, she was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. P. is a married woman who was born in 1986. Her husband, Mr. Eng, was born in 1983. This couple earns their living by farming. They are farmers who rent a 1-hectare plot of land which they use to grow rice. In order to support and improve the rice fields, Mrs. P. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay hired farming laborers for growing rice. Aside from farming, Mr. Eng also earns some income by fishing. 

This couple is working hard to support their three children: one is attending a local school and the others two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and to pay hired farming laborers for growing rice.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from the village of Maribojoc,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, married and has three adult children. Lorna runs a business venture raising crops in the local community.

Lorna has been engaged in her business for 30 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities. Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers.

Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase additional fertilizers. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: En's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen members. Mrs. En is a village bank president. She was born in 1954. She is a widow with two children: one is a monk and one is student.

Mrs. En is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to grow rice for a living. She doesn't have enough money to support her rice field. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for hired laborers to plow her rice field. Aside from farmer she is also village chief, earning a small salary to support her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for hired laborers plow her rice field.

loans.name: Hul's Group

texts.en:
There are five members making up this group loan. Mrs. Hul was born in 1974 and is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the others members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Hul is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice, peanuts and corn for a living. Currently, she wants to grow corn in the dry season, but she doesn't have enough money. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating corn.

Mrs. Hul is a widow with a child who is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating corn.

loans.name: Doeuk

texts.en: Doeuk is a married woman born in 1976. She and her husband, Leng are construction formers. Now they face some problems, because they do not have enough construction supplies to support it. Thus, Doeuk would like to ask for a loan to purchase construction supplies to support her business activities. This couple is working hard with their business to support their six children: three are attending in the local schools and the others are not in school yet. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza D. C. is from the village of San Sebastian, Ramon, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Eliza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eliza owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Eliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rasheedan's Group

texts.en:
Rasheedan is a resident of Mian Channu, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Rasheedan owns a single-room house and has been living in it with her family in the area of Mehrabad for the past 22 years. She is a very helpful person, always willing to help her family in difficult times. Her husband's name is M. R.. He is a mason by profession. Rasheedan is a housewife and stays at home and does her household work. She is the mother of 6 sons and a daughter. Only one of her sons is able to attend school due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son constructs houses, a second one is a factory worker, a third helps his father in his business, and a fourth one sells crockery.

Rasheedan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to buy masonry tools to provide better quality services to his customers. He has been operating this business for the past 5 years and Rasheedan is confident that he will be able to put his business in a better position with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: to buy masonry tools

loans.name: Rham

texts.en:
Rham is from the village of P-3 Malikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children and 2 infant children. To make a living, Rham runs a business venture in the retail sector selling fruit in the local community.

Rham has been engaged in his business for 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. Rham joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rham is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fruit to sell . This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rham from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for his retail business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad R. is from the village of San Sebastian, Ramon, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Trinidad is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Trinidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Trinidad from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian P. is from the village of Nampicuan, Aurora, Isabela. He is 28 years old and single. To make a living, Christian owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing rice processing/milling to local community members. Christian is just starting this business.

In 2011, Christian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christian is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional rice sacks and other materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Christian from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice sacks and other materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Mr. Chou was born in 1968. He and his wife, Mrs. Sok, are firewood sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. Currently, they do not have a chainsaw. Thus, in order and improve this business, Mr. Chou would like to ask for a loan to purchase a gasoline chainsaw for cutting wood. This couple has a child who is a construction worker. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to purchase a gasoline chainsaw for cutting wood

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Aurelia has a business venture running a retail store selling a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. in the local community.

Aurelia has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. Aurelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan cycle taken out by Aurelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her retail store such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya, 47, is married and lives with her husband in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger" in Arhangai province, Mongolia. All her children are grown up and live with their own families. Narantuya and her husband own two small family businesses: a goods-trading business and a wooden products-making business. 

Narantuya herself is responsible for selling a variety of goods out of a rented stall in a local market, while her husband manages the wooden product making business. 

They started their goods trading business in 2006 with working capital of 50,000 MNT. After two years of successful business operations, they managed to start their wooden products business in 2008. Now they make a collection of wooden products such as chairs, tables and beds, etc. Through continuous business operations, they stabilized the business and now have many regular customers who are happy with their service. Now their working capital has reached 450,000 MNT, and they have became two of the experienced businessmen and women in their area. 

With years of business profits, Narantuya has been able to exchange her old car for a new one. They are very honest and polite people. Narantuya is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood in order to expand their wooden product making business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara V. is from the village of San Sebastian, Ramon, Isabela. She is 54 years old. Barbara is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 Php a month for these activities.

In 2009, Barbara joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Barbara is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Khov's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people. Mrs. Khov is the group leader, selected by the other members. She was born in 1955, and she is a widow with seven children: two are employed at a casino club, one is a solider, and the others are students and also help in their mother's business.

Mrs. Khov is a corn middleman who is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to improve the family's living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more corn for selling. She also earns her living by renting her house.

loans.use: to buy more corn for resale.

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in their own house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a teacher at a secondary school while his two sons, who are 2 and 5 years old, go to kindergarten. 

Enhbaatar manages a used clothing trading business out of a rented stall in a local market. He started his business in 2005 with the working capital of 500,000 MNT. His business was quite successful, and that enabled him to increase his working capital to 2,300,000 MNT.  

Sometimes he exchanges his products for dairy products traded by herdsmen. This barter-trading made his business as comfortable as possible for the herdsmen. Enhbaatar is very honest man who wants to own his clothing factory someday. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more used clothing for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Gantogoo

texts.en:
Gantogoo is married and lives with her husband in their own house in Tuv province in Mongolia. Gantogoo and her husband are both retired and now own their own business together. All her children are grown up and live by themselves. 

They used to have a big farm which included chickens, pigs, sheep and goats as well. However, they decided to pay more attention to chicken farming and sold all the other animals to meat trading merchants. They possess a total of 40 chickens and want to expand their business in the future. 

Gantogoo is a hardworking woman who says, "I want to expand our farm building and have heaters and a more advanced water supply system in it." She is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to expand their farm building and to make some improvements in it.

loans.use: to improve their poultry farm building

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en:
Nasanjargal is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house in Zavhan province in Mongolia. Her husband is an officer in a private company in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 7, goes to a secondary school, while her son, age 4, goes to a kindergarten. 

She manages a dairy farm in her town. At first she started her business under the 2010 project to develop and improve farm businesses in the countryside area. With continuous hard work she managed to own her dairy farm. Now she wants to expand her farm business and supply more dairy products to local residents as well as the neighboring area. 

Nasanjargal is a diligent and honest lady who says, "I am working day and night to improve my family’s living conditions." She is requesting a 3,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more cows and equipment for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and equipment

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom C. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Yung, live in a suburb about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still young. 

She and her husband are garment factory workers. In addition, they also grow rice when they are free. Sreymom asked for a Kiva loan once, and she is now requesting another loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Mr. Chheng I. and his wife, Mrs. Kunthea Sok, live along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple has been married since 1993, and they have two sons and one daughter, who are all in school. 

Mr. Chheng I. has been a construction worker for more than three years, while his wife produces rice wine and raises pigs. He is applying for his second loan of $1,200 to help with his wife’s business by purchasing more piglets to raise and buying rice to produce more rice wine.

Photo: Mr. Chheng I. and his wife

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and more rice to make rice wine.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeurn L. (pictured above) is a weaver. Her husband, Mr. Heng Min, is a farmer and raises cows at home. They have two sons and three daughters. Three are married, one has full-time employment and another one is a tailor. 

Mrs. Saroeurn L. is requesting another loan of $500. She will use $200 of the loan to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and the remaining $300 for buying fabrics for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business and fabrics for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyleak K. (pictured above) is 27 years old, and her husband, Mr. Piset Lay, is 29 years old. They have two young daughters and live in a suburb about 15 kilometers away from Phnom Penh.
